resources.string: "Contacts permissions are needed for providing email completions."

We Recommend all sales to be done from the "Online POS" located on the "Sales Register" tab, for direct synchronisation with the Esopos server, but if you must sell offline ensure you follow this simple guide to setup your Shop for offline sales.

- To avoid loss of offline sales data ensure you synchronise your offline sales with the Esopos server at the end of each business dayby connecting to the internet and following steps outlined in this guide on tab "How to Send my Offline Sales data to the Esopos Server".
- We recommend the use of Google Chrome, Android browser, for Offline Sales. Other Browsers such as Firefox are also supported.
- Ensure you donot clear your browser cache if you are using Offline sales module to avoid loss of offline sales settings and data .
If for any reason you need to clear cache on your browser, ensure you synchronise all offline sales to Esopos server before you carry out browser cache clearing action.
- The first step in setting your shop for offline sales is configuring the offline sales settings.
- To configure offline sales settings, go to the Navigation bar, click on the "Offline Sales" link, a drop down will appear, then click on "Offline Settings" link.

- Wait for 30 seconds while the system configure and load the offline sales settings on your device automatically. Ensure you wait until you see \"Offline Configuration Success\" on your screen before you proceed with other actions.
- Go to Navigation bar, click on the \"Offline Sales\" link, a drop down will appear, then click on \"Offline POS\". this action will load the Offline POS register.
- On the Offline POS Register enter products you want to sell, and click on the submit button to complete the sales transaction.
Note: Your Sales are stored offline, and will require you to synchronise with the esopos server once you regain internet connections. We advice you do this everyday at the end of business day
- The first step to send your offline sales data to Esopos server is to connect to a functional internet.
- Go to Navigation bar, click on the \"Off-Line Sales\" link, a drop down will appear, then click on \"Offline Sales\". This action will load all Offline Sales transactions.
- To send a transaction to Esopos server, click on the \"View\" link relating to that transaction. This action will load the particular sales transaction.
- Next, click on the \"Submit to server\" button, this action will send the transaction to Esopos server and generate a receipt. which can be printed or sent to your customer via email.
NB: This CART is not saved and it\'s unique to this STORE, This transaction is solely between you and the store owner
